website_summaries.verdict: Many smaller pets like to sleep in crates or kennel enclosures at night, and the MidWest Quiet Time Pet Bed is a good fit for those tighter spaces. We like the non-skid element, since the bed is essentially the size of a large pillow.
pros: Designed to provide extra comfort for smaller pets in crates, kennels or other enclosures
Non-skid bottom holds bed in place
Completely machine washable and very comfortable
cons: Not intended for pets larger than 25 pounds
Durability is questionable with pets that like to chew or scratch
Soft foam interior is not as supportive as memory foam therapeutic models

customer_reviews.title: The purfect box.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the $$. The box is the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Cash

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing this review to help you pick the right size, specially for big dog owners.I was a little worried about the size I should get. I get the 48" for my 2 Weimaraners (80 pounds female and 92 pounds male). Perfect fit for their size! They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shailin Marie

customer_reviews.title: Note on washing
customer_reviews.text: Just here to let people know that I washed this in the washing machine on the hottest setting and then put it in the dryer on the hottest setting and it came out fine. In case anyone is wondering. It says only wash cold but washing it hot worked for me. I washed it hot because my dog got sick and vet told me to wash all her bedding on the hot setting.
customer_reviews.author: Erna

customer_reviews.title: First bed my dog hasn't chewed up!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this bed. He's a 50 lb american bulldog. This is the first bed (out of many) that he hasn't torn to shreds. It's a nice color and the beddin can be easily taken off and thrown in the washer. I think I will be a larger one when this one wears out or if my dog gets any bigger. So far he doesn't mind the size at all. 😆
customer_reviews.author: Mickey I

customer_reviews.title: NOT a pet bed - just a flimsy pad that stinks!
customer_reviews.text: This pad was really a disappointment. Its very thin and insubstantial, poorly made, smells terrible, offers no support whatsoever. The picture is so misleading, showing a medium-sized dog on a thick, plush bed, when the actual pad is not thicker than a folded towel. I returned this, as its outrageous to pay nearly $50 for such a rag. This product shouldn't be described as a pet bed. Its NOT a bed and is a complete waste of money. Don't buy this for your pet; if he could talk he wouldn't thank you!
customer_reviews.author: R Tattersfield

customer_reviews.title: Flattens quickly
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to like this bed (though he really has no choice, as it covers his entire crate): he hasn't destroyed it or crumpled it up at one end of the crate. I also like that this bed is thin enough and compressible enough to fit under a divider in a Midwest crate. However, that feature comes at a price: the bed gets very flat fairly quickly. The difference from out-of-package thickness and a month of use is quite dramatic and can be seen in the attached photos. My dog slept on the left side of the bed, and the right side remained dog-free due to the divider. There's a really noticable difference in thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable and develops odor.
customer_reviews.text: My 10m old puppy had half the stuffing out of this mattress in 2 days. Stocking very delicate so easy to pull apart. So we let him continue to use it as a towel/floor covering for his crate and it developed an awful odor. My dog is very clean and housebroken so I’m not quite sure why this smell developed. Now that there is no stuffing sand it is odorous, I threw it out. All of this in less than a week. Will not reorder and do not recommend unless you bathe your dog daily and your dog doesn’t have any teeth or claws....
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: If you look at the picture with the dog laying on top of this bed, you get the impression that this bed is plush and firm as the dog hardly made any indentation on the bed. That's because this picture is fake. The bed arrived in a box that felt like it was empty (that's how light it was). One thing I can't stand is false advertising. If you love your dog, get something else as this provides no cushion at all. UPDATE: to clarify, the dog in the photo got there via photoshop. Also, the seams are tearing apart, and that's with very little usage... (the dog isn't a big fan of the kennel/crate. Hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JWo

customer_reviews.title: Cozy Cavalier
customer_reviews.text: My dog was laying on his new bed before I had fully gotten it out of the box! Instant cozy appeal to my King Charles Cavalier - he knew anything this soft had to be for him.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Prop 65 warning
customer_reviews.text: I did not see anything about a Prop 65 warning on the entire product description. I reviewed it again, and there isn't anything said about a Prop 65 warning! It is sold as an Amazon product! The product I received is soft, but I would like to know what is in it that makes it a possible cancer risk.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Loses it's fluff quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these so far, one ordered in October/2017 and another in November/2017. The bed from October is already almost flat and has been washed twice. So it looks like although these are very easy to clean, the filling is not going to last long (or keep it's fluff)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My dog Frodo loves his new bed (and so does our cat Ari)!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, lightweight bed, and is easy to wash, which I really like. I can put the entire bed in the washing machine (I've washed it once so far), and it comes out of the dryer looking as good as new! It may not be as thick as some beds, but for a crate liner or a bed that is easily washed and looks attractive, this seems to be a great bed. If you are looking for a bed that offers a lot of support for an elderly dog, this might not be the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Liz FlaglerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The bed is super comfy, and my husky loves lounging on it
customer_reviews.text: This bed fits perfectly in the MidWest extra large wire kennel. The bed is super comfy, and my husky loves lounging on it, and my daughter tryed keeping it for herself! To wash, I put through regular wash cycle, then over my deck rail to dry in the sun. I fluffed in the dryer for about 5 minutes after it was dry, and the bed looked new.
customer_reviews.author: IowaMom09

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and perfect for a puppy with room to grow!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large size for our new (to us) puppy. It's perfect for her to grow into. This is a very soft dog bed. It's a great color. I have not washed it yet but I plan to let it air dry. Our dog, Willow, loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: creid

customer_reviews.title: Thin and flat.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars,I would. For the price? I can buy better beds at Walmart. These are thin, flat, useless. I bought two of them (could kick myself for it now), and even stacked on top of each other, they are too thin to be comfortable. I have the two of them stacked, plus another bed (from Walmart that is thicker and has a removable washable cover which these do not) in my dog's crate. I wish I would have returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Tessk

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed, super soft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog bed to go into a dog crate and it fits perfect. It's very soft and has enough loft for my small dog of 9 pounds to be very comfortable on it. I would recommend this padding for any small dog. This is actually big enough to fit a Scottish terrier or a wire Fox terrier size. I'm using it for a miniature pinscher and she has more than enough room on it to sleep 3 of them on it.
customer_reviews.author: Vtuc

customer_reviews.title: Skin rash from bed. I would give it a zero if I could. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed for my dog. The trouble is I can't even handle it. It gave me an immediate allergic reaction. Headache, sore throat and skin rash. I think it must have been used and sprayed with some sort of pesticide. It smelled as soon as I opened the plastic around it. I thought it might go away if I wash it. NOT. It's time to throw it out in the garbage, where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: I love these they are super comfy and soft. I bought 3 small and one medium. They fit my window hammocks and the medium is in his crate for travel. He likes them. Easy to clean and good price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory And Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Machine wash on gentle cycle!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these over the past year. I like the fact they are machine washable however I suggest using the gentle cycle. I had one come apart at the seem after it's second wash. The other one I have gets washed on a regular cycle, twice a month for about a year now and is holding help well. Overall they are nice beds and my Dachshund seems to enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought one of these beds for my dog about 4 years ago but decided to replace it with a bigger one as my dog is now elderly and has heath problems. The bed I just received is even nicer than I remember the smaller bed being. Plus, they are so easy to clean. We've always just put them in the washer and dryer and never had any issues. Not a tear, stain, or anything. The price on Amazon is also great. I bought my first bed in a retail store and paid a lot more for a much smaller bed. This time I shopped smarter. I would definitely buy another one if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C

customer_reviews.title: Very soft but not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this bed because of all the good reviews, but it didn’t turn out like I expected. The bed was definitely very plush and seemed comfortable enough at first glance but there isn’t much padding on the inside. I expected this bed to have more cushion and it didn’t. If I stepped on it I could feel the floor and that was no good since The main reason I got it was to have a good cushion support. The pad is more pillow like than a bed. It was a nice pillow type bed but I wouldn’t recommend this for older dogs or heavy dogs. I purchased the xl size.
customer_reviews.author: JJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cancer Warning
customer_reviews.text: The mat has a bit of a weird odor. I kept it inside the plastic to keep it clean before traveling. When I took it out, I noticed this paper inside that says P65 Cancer and Reproductive Harm warning. I didn’t see this in the description and maybe it should be...? Other than that, the 48” fits in the Giant Skykennel and my dog is very comfy. Haven’t washed yet and he usually doesn’t chew his mats so should be good there.
customer_reviews.author: Lesia

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: We threw these out after a month. They are no more support than the ground they are laid on. Just a cheap way to push an inferior product. Very difficult to clean anything that is on them. No support what so ever. They constantly scrunch up so that they have to constantly be attended to. Ridiculous and such a waste of money. Do not!! Repeat....do not waste your money. A sheet or rug works better....even a bath towel!!
customer_reviews.author: Critique god

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought one similar to this from Tractor Supply for a much steeper price, since this one looked identical I was excited to purchase it. I planned to have two so while I'm washing the original one I could have a second to replace in my dogs kennel right away. This bed lasted one day, my dog tore it to complete fluff. Ironically, the one from Tractor Supply is still going strong and its been 6 months since I purchased it. Don't be fooled by this look a like
customer_reviews.author: Shelby R Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the other crate bed I bought is quite difficult to wash. This is thinner and easier to put into the washer. So I’m rotating crate beds. My labs are basically seals that sleep inside at night and live in pool all day. This translates to stinky dogs and stinky dog furniture. I don’t recommend this for chewers or younger dogs. The bed doesn’t have a lot of cushion nor support. I wish it was thicker or had more support but it serves its function for now. I don’t think it’s going to handle the frequent washing
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn B

customer_reviews.title: Dog pee nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I have two potty trained older Golden's, no accidents in the hose since puppy hood. This bed is thin out of the box and has a strange chemical smell. My older dog peed on it the very first night in my home. The bed then warped and developed lumps after washing. To ad insult to injury the dog and now the cat peed on this again. It went right in the trash where it belongs. It's a shame I had bought two one for each dog an am now afraid to open the second box.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUT- DIDN’T LAST A WEEK
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed both in this bed and the company. I had the bed less than a week before my puppy chewed a hole in the super thin bottom lining. I don’t understand how you make a bed for a dog that can’t last a week. I saw the reference to chewers and per the direction, get multiple chew toys with the puppy at all time. That did nothing. This bed is not made to stand up to anything. And the customer service was unhelpful, uncaring and unapologetic. DO NOT RECOMMEND. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Softer than I thought would be.
customer_reviews.text: The dog bed is actually quite nice. The measurements were exact and the non-skid bottom helps on the wood floors. The bed turned out to be plusher that I thought. It is not as plush as memory foam or gel, but for the price it is spot on. I purchased the large size for my 50 lbs. Pitbull. The one who claimed it and sleeps on it is the 12 lbs. Yorkie. In conclusion, it is perfect for a Yorkie that is an alpha and spoiled.
customer_reviews.author: Wacky Tacky

customer_reviews.title: Ella loves it! -check update
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 48 inch for my 75-ish pound lab mix. Ella immediately laid down on it and went to sleep. It's a nice size for her. It's not too firm but I like how fluffy it is and I believe it is machine washable so that's a major plus. I am very happy with the quality and I'm definitely happy about the low price. Thank you! Update- Don't wash this!! I've washed it twice and the stuffing goes to the middle and some parts are completely flat because of that. Both of my labradors still sleep on it but I wish it was more durable. Cool that it's cheap tho.
customer_reviews.author: Craig McCarter

customer_reviews.title: not as expected
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice pillow. it is very soft. BUT the pillow went completely flat after one day of use. i bought this for my 70lb german shepherd. she used it the first day when it was nice and fluffy, but now that it went flat she refuses to use it at all. i tried returning it but because i didnt have a box to ship it back in they gave me a partial refund. of like $4. im very disappointed in this item and the service i received. i feel they should have sent me a box to return it in since i didnt have one.
customer_reviews.author: mgrubbe85

customer_reviews.title: High quality and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn’t chew so I can’t rate it for that type of quality, however it is definitely super soft and comfy for my dog. I’ve washed and dried it over the past years and it still looks good. Fits great in her little kennel that she loves sleeping in. When I first purchased this one, I purchased another style from someone else and that bed lost its shape and fluffiness after a couple of washes. So I bought another one of these great beds as my backup when the other is in the wash. Great purchase. I strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Really? Flat as a pancake, flatter...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 15 pound toy poodle whoa at 11 years old is developing Osteoarthritis... and seems to like our nicely thick fluffy sofa and chair pillows, so we thought we'd get him his own for his crate at night... this though is the skimpiest of pads, put a couple grains of rice under it and your can easily feel them with your fingers thru this "pad"... now that's skimpy and useless. Why not cushion it a bit, Quiet Time """DELUXE"""?
customer_reviews.author: W. Albert

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware; not well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fit my Midwest crate. Absolutely a waste of money. The first day I put it in my puppies crate, I left for ONE HOUR to run an errand. Came back to find all of the stuffing out of the bed and all over the inside of the crate where he was merrily chewing it. Hard to tell if he ingested any, so I will spend the next couple of days watching him like a hawk. ONE HOUR, he was able to completely open the end seam. I've had dogs for 13 years and never seen anything so quickly deconstructed.
customer_reviews.author: Leaser

customer_reviews.title: Very deceptive looking. Save your $.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not what I expected. It was much thinner than it looked. It only took a few days for the "soft" material to matt down. I have a Beagle (not a big dog) and when she lays on it you can see that she can feel the crate under it. So I use it as a blanket for her to lay on the carpet and bought a different one for the crate (ie; her house). Wouldnt buy again. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Thin and Floppy....Just go to Walmart, their $9.97 beds are 10X better then these
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these beds for my dogs and was excited to receive them, was extremely disappointed when I opened the first box and pulled it out. The beds are cheap, very cheap and yes I realize they are a cheap price so u get what you pay for but SERIOUSLY? They are so thin and floppy that I didn’t see them lasting more then a day or two before they were completely flat. I didn’t even open the second box, i instead got on my phone and did my return on both beds and took them to the UPS store, then went to Walmart and found beds for $9.97 that are of wayyyy superior quality.
customer_reviews.author: Beth B

customer_reviews.title: Good size, but hard to wash.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our German Shepard. It's the perfect size. I had purchased this bed because I saw it was machine washable. I had assumed the cover came off, but that's not the case. The only way you can wash it is to put the whole thing in the washer and it's huge! I feel like it'll have to go to the laundry mat into one of their big washing machines. That seems like a lot of hassle, so I'll probably be buying a new bed with a removable cover.
customer_reviews.author: joyfulcryst

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!! Don’t Be Fooled Like I Was!!
customer_reviews.text: What a HUGE waste of money!!! I read the reviews and given the VERY high number of positive ratings, decided to give this bed a try for my female Weimaraner. Sadly and as so many other reviewers report, with one light tug (on day 2!!), the stitching came apart creating a small hole. Within 2 more days, the bed was completely ruined with filling all over the place. The craftsmanship is very poor in quality. Additionally, this NOT plush and has a weird chemical odor. A lot of money wasted. Trust me, don’t waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SWP

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a bed
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely more of a crate pad than a pet bed, which is the reason for the three stars. I was disappointed but life went on. As an FYI (and not a consideration in the product rating) My dog is an Amstaff and likes to destroy things, including this. Whatever the contents of this product are, or whatever chemical treatment is on the contents of this product, once he ripped it open but kept sleeping on it he developed a really terrible rash all over his stomach and the insides of his legs and had to go on antibiotics and a steroidal shampoo three times a week.
customer_reviews.author: KateCME

customer_reviews.title: Lab loves this
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my 85 lb black lab. As soon as I opened it, he knew it was his and laid down on it immediately. I washed it once and let it air dry and it held up really well. It's a great bed that's easy to transport and looks nice. Plus the gray hides most of his black fur and paw prints so it doesn't look dirty.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Flat within a week
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that this dog bed received such good reviews. I have only one complaint but it’s a deal breaker. This bed went flat in a week and since it’s in my puppy’s cage, he sleeps on it frequently thought the day and all night. When I touch it, I can feel the hard base of the crate below. This frustrates me to no end. Then again, the price is a little too good to be true. If you still wanna buy this, then you will love how easy to wash it is and the fabric used is so soft. But I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: jx99

customer_reviews.title: Used and DISGUSTING
customer_reviews.text: I’m furious at this dog bed came used and gross. It smells like animal excretion. The tag has obviously been chewed on.. seriously amazon get your act together! Disgusting FURIOUS
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: My Spoiled Dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of dogs. So we have them sleep in kennels at night. I bought these beds because they fit the kennels good. Other beds I have bought were to small. The dogs even the newest puppies seem to love the beds. I am very happy with the purchase. I have not washed them yet, but will take the word of every body else that they wash up good. Being as they don't have covers is the only reason why I didn't give 5 stars. My decision to buy but the cover would make it perfect if it were to come off. I would suggest this bed to others and I would buy again if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: MaTaylor67

customer_reviews.title: Quality far greater than expected for the price --- my puppy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The material is extremely soft and tightly woven 'rose' patterned material is sturdy - my 4 month old puppy chewed at it for hours, with no damage to the bed. And she is now sleeping on it in her crate without a peep. Very well cushioned, anti-slide material on the bottom survived her death-grip teeth with no damage. I bought the grey bed, and honestly, it looks like a high end pillow. Yeah, I was half tempted to rest my own head on it. I don't write many Amazon reviews (I probably should do that more) but I'm loving my new puppy and I LOVE this bed! So.. big 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: T. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping to love this. It's attractive and the color is great. It claims to be machine washable but in reality it's not. I have efficient machines with very lite cycles and this bed still lost its shape the seams broke. I'm very disappointed because I hate having to continue to shop for new products for my puppy and continue to see which ones work and dont. Maybe they can improve stitching and/or replace item if it becomes ruined. But for less than 10 bucks in guess you get what you pay for one wash worth. Or a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed and great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dog bed — attractive, fits in a kennel well, and feels comfortable. Just be sure check the size carefully before you order it. The size given for the one I bought was about 2" too short, because it had been measured across the top and to the floor on both sides. It needs to be measured straight down the length of the side for a true measure. I got it exchanged through Amazon quickly, easily and without any shipping costs. I'm very happy with it. The the price for the bed is much more reasonable that the price for most other dog beds. My dog loves it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rieselman

customer_reviews.title: Economic Puppy Bed
customer_reviews.text: Apparently no bed is chew-proof for my pit bull baby girl. I have bought expensive ones and more economic ones. They all lasted about two weeks for the first 6 months of her life, so I am not taking any stars off for not being chew proof. Now that she is older, the current one in my office has lasted over a month, and the one in her sleeping crate has lasted 3 weeks. Crossing fingers. (And yes, she has all kinds of toys to chew on - she just likes shredding cloth things a lot.) This is easy to wash and the fill stays in place and does not wad up in one corner.
customer_reviews.author: Farm Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this comfy, plush bed
customer_reviews.text: Three out of five of my cats use this extra plush and extremely soft bed. -I purchased the 22 inch. It is 21L x 12W x 1.5H Inches -It is very soft, plush and somewhat firm -It is machine washable and you just put the whole bed in the wash. I have washed it a few times now and it has come out great. You do have to re-mold it just slightly back to its shape but its not difficult and does not take long -All of my cats can fit on this bed and they range in size between 10 and 17 pounds. It is fairly narrow but they still all fit and most of them love it!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a 9 mo. old puppy that didn't seem satisfied to lay on blankets on the couch, as our older dog does. So we bought this cushion and the moment we laid it out, she happily plopped on it. We can put it on the couch or the floor and she knows its her home-base. It's very soft and I can put the whole thing in the washing machine and dryer when needed. THAT was a detail I looked for when shopping for it and it washed up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Better beds elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately all three of my dogs do not like this bed. It is very thin and moves around a lot. I feel like my dogs are basically sleeping on the floor with this bed and one of them will literally bunch it up or push it around to try and make it comfy. I bought two other dog beds from different companies and they love those and avoid this one completely. I think for now I will put it in their crate. They don't use the crate much, but when I put it in there, they enjoy it much better. So as a mat for a kennel, it's works, but otherwise they don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Did not last the chew
customer_reviews.text: Received on July 2nd. Today is July 17th and it just went in the trash after the puppy chewed through it in the middle of the night. I got it for her spay so she wouldn’t try and jump in the bed and she just got her stitches out today so maybe that was her way of telling me she could get back in the bed. Just disappointing considering the price and size I got. For reference, she’s 6months old, 60 lbs, a Newfie mix and i got the large. It was a good size while it lasted and my 10 year old yorkie loved stealing it when she wasn’t looking so it’s good for small guys as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dog bed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these beds and am using them as protection on chairs and couches. And they double as beds at night. I have two little schnauzers and they like to view their world from atop the furniture, and I don’t mind at all. Nothing else provides me with this kind of flexibility and they are very well made. It has become the “go to” place for my dogs to land.
customer_reviews.author: linda mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: So good I had to buy a second one!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is very plush and comfy. My cat (11lbs) and puppy (35lbs and growing fast) share one large bed without having to be on top of each other. They both love it so much I bought a second one to replace a smaller bed they were trying unsuccessfully to share. It resolved the only tension spot in their relationship; who got the hall bed. During potty training I found out how easy the covers are to clean. They seem very waterproof on top, so much so that the memory foam never seemed to get wet at all. The covers washed / cleaned and dried easily.
customer_reviews.author: R Miller

customer_reviews.title: Landing beds!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about my dog, as he constantly sleeps, between floors, on the carpeted landings of our three story home and is often at risk of being tripped on. He has a bed of his own, but I think it's his way of eavesdropping on two levels of "Hoomans" at a time. I measured the landings and decided that a bed, of this exact measurement, on each of the landings (furthest side from traffic) was the solution. He now spies on each of us in comfort and officially has more beds than any other member of my family! This bed is easily cleaned, comfortable, and warm. I highly recommend it for fur-baby napping!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the cost. Thick padding, soft cover.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on many of the dog beds listed and most of them had minimal padding and if there was padding it was thickest on the perimeter. This Dog Bed has 2" high box edges as opposed to a knife edge like many of them. It is uniformly thick like a nice mattress for my dog, not just a pad. The cover material appears to be of high quality, like it will hold up and look good for awhile. My dog loves it, has slept on it every day since we got it and totally ignoring her old bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Aside from the chewing ...
customer_reviews.text: They are chewing off one corner and I don't know how long it will last. I'm just glad I didn't spend a fortune on the bed. They do like it, all three of one. They have all the toys piled up on it along with the blanket I just bought. They all find it comfortable, from the biggest to the smallest. Overall, it looks likely to make them happy for now. Until someone really gets serious about chewing. But with a little luck, since none of them are puppies and not serious chewers, maybe they won't destroy it. It remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn ArmstrongTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Updated... Purchased twice and not happy
customer_reviews.text: **Update 02/17/19- Bed has already gone flat. Not much padding left at all. I am really disappointed because the last one lasted quite a bit longer before going flat. Will be looking for another one unfortunately** My pug loves this! It fits in his crate perfectly. I've purchased two at this point since the first one went flat. I was worried about him shredding and destroying this as he does with his toys but we are on our second one and fingers crossed there has been no damage. The first one lasted us about 6 months or so but considering the price and what you could pay at a pet store this one works well
customer_reviews.author: Alicia V

customer_reviews.title: Fits my crate ok, a little small and pre-lumped.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used bed "Condition: Used - Very Good - Item will come repackaged." The bed came pre lumped, but no doubt by some nesting dog. I have a large crate for my cats and wanted a pad for it. Have another crate and bought the same kind of pad for it. The bottom of the pad doesn't hold up over time. I've have never washed the other pad, but the entire bottom has turned into powdery flakes. This new pad has the same kind of bottom material. I knocked off two stars for the bottom and the tendency to lump. Cats do like it. I think it will be fine for them.
customer_reviews.author: ParkSDTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Read This. Especially if you need this for a cat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my neutered male cat for his travel pen. He not only hates it , but drags it forcefully out of the cage. It is the damnedest thing you've ever seen. This has to be the softest material known to man. For some reason the cat hates it. I called the company to see if they had a remedy. Washing? Spraying with cat nip oil? Unfortunately the nice lady said no ☹️. She said he probably hates the feel of it. And cats are very picky. If this was two times thicker i would keep it for a travel pillow for me. But alas im sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: BTW

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bed Washes Easily With Front Load Washer
customer_reviews.text: My 3 rescue dogs love these beds, I got two, and they share them. My dogs range in weight from 28-35lbs. I have had to wash them twice, and spot clean (green machine) a couple times, and every time they came out clean, and retain their shape and softness. I go to the laundry mat because I don't have a front load washer, and I use the triple loader. I can fit both in there (folded in half). It cost me less than $5 to wash them once a month when I give them their baths. I would recommend these beds. It seems like they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Scott

customer_reviews.title: Completely flat after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for two weeks now. We have a 6 month old 60lb pit bull. He loved it. He doesn’t chew it besides to drag it and lay it down in another area. It hasn’t torn or anything yet from that. I give it two stars overall because.... maybe his weight did this... but the whole bed is thin/flat... and looks like we have had it for years. Will not buy again. Looks and feels pretty cheap. For the price I guess it was ok
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Elderly Hound
customer_reviews.text: I had an elderly hound who unfortunately passed away. This bed made his last weeks much easier for me. The bed is entirely machine washable (on delicate) and can be dried (again on delicate, low/no heat). My poor old dog began losing bladder control, and while the cover on most dog beds are washable, the pad itself would often be wet and couldn't be easily cleaned. I searched for an alternative and found this bed. I am 100% happy with how easy it is to wash and dry. I'd recommend this bed for anyone with an elderly dog or perhaps a puppy who is still learning.
customer_reviews.author: S. H. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves this bed. It’s soft and easy to clean. My puppy did pee on it, even tho she is potty trained. It was my fault .... I left her in the kennel for about 3 hours, while I was out and about. She’s only 2 and a half months. Washed her bed with other stuff on delicate and than I let it dry in the hot sun outside. It still looks like new and my puppy has her favorite bed back. She’s very good at Not chewing her bed, I won’t allow it so I don’t know how well it will last with other dogs who do like to chew.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gust

customer_reviews.title: So soft & Boston/French bulldog approved
customer_reviews.text: This dog bed is so soft! If they made a human sized one, it would be best napping Pad! I purchased the 30 inch (medium) bed for my Boston/French mix. I debated between sizes, but I’m so glad I went with the 30 inch. It’s the perfect size for our dog to lay down and stretch out. We’ve gone through quite a few dog beds because our dog would chew right through them and tear them to shreds. So far, he hasn’t wanted to chew it, but just lay on top of it. It’s just as soft and snuggly as our sofa throws. I definitely give this 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Super Soft and Easy to Clean!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bed for my feisty Maltipoo puppy who is a chewer. After almost two weeks, it is still in great condition with no holes. It's super easy to clean (washing machine and dryer safe!) - I recommend washing it by itself (but that's mostly due to any pet messes on the bed). And it is incredibly soft. The bottom is slightly plastic-y and my puppy has learned that if he gets too hot on the soft side that he can flip it over and sleep on the cooler plastic side. I definitely recommend this bed for non-aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Bed for chewy puppy’s. Washes up great!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this since May 15th. We got our Golden Retriever puppy and she loves this bed. She chews it, plays with it, drags it all over the house. She even sleeps on it. I have washed it over 5x and it has held its shape and softness. It is very soft. I even used a little bleach in the wash and it didn’t hurt it at all. Wouldn’t recommend it but had to as she had a accident on it. Over all we are very pleased at how it has held up. If and when we need to purchase another one we will get this brand. a+ all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but flattened within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I don't know that I would call it chew proof, but our Australian Shepherd mix hasn't tried to chew it, and he has chewed other beds. I haven't tried to clean it yet but its been almost 2 months and we haven't needed to. The material is very soft, however the stuffing went flat very fast in the center. We compensated for that by putting a cheap 5 dollar bed (that he had started to tear apart) beneath it. That has worked very well so far. Perfect in our 36 inch crate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great padding for large dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This bed is really thin, probably not the best for large/giant breed dogs. I washed before using and discovered that the stuffing isn't attached to anything, it took some "fluffing" to get it back into place before use. Within a day my dog got a hold of a loop attached to the bed. I ended up having to remove the loop before my dog ate it. By day three the stitching where the loop was had badly come undone. I ended up having to throw out the bed so the dog wouldn't eat the stuffing. Pros: inexpensive, fits inside the midwest crate. Cons: cheaply made, stuffing gets easily folded inside after washing, thin bed not the best for larger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: No permanent fuzzy problem
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy beds at Ocean State that were a good price but over repeated use and washings, I could not get the tiny stubborn little dog hair balls off of the beds so they are clean, but never look like it. If anything they get more entrenched after washing and drying. I now have a collection of them, still in fine shape, but embarrassing to have lying around my house. This bed doesn't collect hair in that way. I'm a fan. It's also easier to vacuum as it doesn't get sucked into the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl Girl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I bought the 29" by 21" for my 13 lb Shih Tzu and it's the perfect size. I also have a smaller puppy who loves it too--it's very soft and while not extremely padded, they seem to be comfortable on it. It's also VERY durable. My puppy digs in it and chews on it and throws it around, and it still looks brand new after months of abuse. It's also been peed on, and it washed in the washing machine very well. Would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for puppies or chewers.
customer_reviews.text: Destroyed within a day. The puppy chewed right through this bed within a few hours. It was thick and fluffy and lush upon arrival, but I can't speak to its washibility or ability to hold its shape (didn't last long enough). I actually wasn't expecting it to be quite so fluffy, because I would never have purchased it for a teether. The only other bed she's chewed through was one that already had a broken zipper and was an easy target, and even that one was just a small hole. This was utterly destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great dog bed so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 42" along with the Amazon Basics 42" dog crate. It fits inside if it pretty well, it just leaves a very small gap around the edges. I have a 35 lb puppy and there is plenty of room for her to grow in the crate. This picture is after I put it together and gave her a bath, she immediate grabbed her favorite ball and made herself at home inside the crate, so I'm taking that as a good sign. She has chewed on it a bit, but the bed has shown no signs of wear or tear so far.
customer_reviews.author: Luke D

customer_reviews.title: Good but not excellent...
customer_reviews.text: No washable cover. I prefer those, but in-between washes I sanitize in the dryer for 10 min. It's not as plush (thick) as I thought it would be and goes flat rather quickly (had it 6 weeks). It also has a hole along the seam already. It's super soft and looks good, but the quality is not as great as I would hope for. It probably won't last me more than 6 months, and this is just a bed for the family room, not the one she sleeps on every night. If using in a kennel I would get something thicker and more durable, like Bark Box Bed. More $, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBooks21

customer_reviews.title: Super-soft, well-made, and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful dog bed! I bought one for each of my dogs and they love them. They're extremely soft and well-padded with a nice pillowed-edge for their heads. We've had them for a year and a half now, have washed them many times (they hold up well!), and they're still nice and soft. They also haven't flattened like I was half-expecting, which is great. The 42" bed fits perfectly in the 42"we bought--it just slips right in and lays flat with no fussing! I highly recommend this dog bed and MidWest as a company from what I've seen with the 4 items I've purchased from them.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Cox

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: While I am aware this is not a new chew/tear bed I can not believe it was already ripped at the seam area within a day...I have a big dog an he doesn’t chew until the beds are old an orn and once the worn part shows some stuffing then he thinks it’s a game and destroys them...this happened after one day in his crate.. I saw the seam coming undone with stuffing sticking out an that was it he spotted it and that was the end of it
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Hunter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BED - BAD DOG
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the 2nd one of these I've purchased. I eventually had to get rid of the first one because my dog threw up something so awful on it that I couldn't even bear to put it through my washing machine. I'm sure the bed would have been fine - it's great quality - but the thought of washing my clothing after that mess had gone through the machine... better to just buy a new one. In short I love this kennel bed! May hate my dog a bit right now though...
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not much padding.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my dog would lay outside with us in the evenings. The top is very soft and my dog likes that - but there's almost no padding to speak of so she doesn't stay long. The other thing that's a bit odd is the sound it makes when she walks on it - the bottom of the pad is pretty stiff and sounds like wrinkling paper. Maybe that'll go away in time? Anyway - I'm replacing one that seems to be better quality. Nothing "wrong" with this one per se, but I was hoping for more.
customer_reviews.author: B Parker

customer_reviews.title: Paco Approved
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality plush bed. Fits my chihuahua/dachschund mixs crate perfectly. He wouldnt have anything to do with his crate before I put the bed in.. Now he sleeps in it willingly and takes his dental treats and bully sticks in his crate to enjoy. Even though my dog has plenty of toys and chews to tear up, he did get at the bed and caused a little damage before I was able to stop him; so if your dog is any type of chewer, the bed will not hold up to it. However, I found a way to prevent the dog from chewing on the bed directly. The 23 by 18 inch bed fits right into a pillowcase :)
customer_reviews.author: Eztli

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t withstand the washing machine
customer_reviews.text: We mainly kept this in our crate for our new dachshund puppy. Being as we were training him, we needed to wash this a couple times as he had a few accidents. After washing maybe 3 times, the seams separated on one side and stuffing started coming out. We ended up returning it and getting one from Walmart for about $6 that has been washed many times and is still good to go. It was very soft though and the dog loved laying on it. Not sure if it’s really chew proof as the puppy never tried chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brigette

customer_reviews.title: Holds up okay, my dog likes it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that doesn't really dig or chew on beds. The most beaten up this bed has gotten is in my washing machine (round barrel type, no agitation). It has a few little rips in the underside fabric, which seemed to appear mysteriously. It has held up pretty well overall. After the 2nd run through the washing machine the insides have gotten very lumpy, but my dog still likes it. I found almost the exact same bed at Ross for $12 a month later that had a fleecy brown fabric instead.
customer_reviews.author: Emily N

customer_reviews.title: Original Shipped to Us with Holes; Great Customer Service;  Replaced It
customer_reviews.text: Edited with Update: I contact customer service via email and the gal was great to work with... after submitting photos of the bed in poor condition as well as item/order information the company replaced the bed with one that is perfect without holes. I preferred the lighter color of the original, but am thrilled to have a functional dog bed! Husky approved! Initial Review: I want to love this, however, am super frustrated that is came to us with HOLES in it. We purchased this as ‘new’. It should NOT have holes straight out of the plastic/box. I think that is unacceptable for the amount we paid. Very disappointed. Literally holes everywhere... in all corners and the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When I first got this it was nice and fluffy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly dog because he was having trouble getting up and down from the couch. When I first got this it was nice and fluffy. I have a German Shephard and it was the perfect size for him. I have had this for a couple months now and it has gone really flat, it's like a thick rug now. At least he doesn't have to lay on the hard wood floor. I'm a little disappointed it went flat so fast.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Great size and softness but a little thin
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my dog after going through traditional dog mats that only washable when you remove the outer lining. This mat is so easy to clean as you can just through it in the washing machine any time and it dries perfectly as well. The color and softness are great, but it's thinner than it looks especially once your pup lays on it. If it was made twice as thick, it would be perfect but overall great purchase and WAY better than traditional mats you can't wash through and through.
customer_reviews.author: SS1113

customer_reviews.title: Just average...  have to replace them often.
customer_reviews.text: These beds don't wash well, it's like the stuffing comes out and don't put them in the dryer! LOL! The little black rubber dots come off and stick inside your dryer! I thought I had bugs at first. I can't get them off! Ugh! And I have a brand new dryer! I love them when they're new... before you have to wash them. I prefer beds with removable/washable covers.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed from the start!
customer_reviews.text: This is most likely the worst pet bed I’ve had. It compresses easily and does not recover it’s original shape after washing. The material used for stuffing is not fluffy, not soft, and not filled completely. I’ve only had this bed for a few months, and I would not recommend it to anyone. Very disappointing Midwest!
customer_reviews.author: Shurbee

customer_reviews.title: Better for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bed for my 13 year old 40 lb dog. I know she is at the top of the weight recommendation, but this bed went flat within a week. Also, even though it states the "no skid bottom" will prevent it from sliding on hardwood floors, that is not the case. I have hardwood floors and it slides every time I bump it with my foot or my girl tries to get off of it. The bed is very soft, pretty and easy to wash, however I wouldn't recommend it for any dog over 25 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Bush

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs that like stuffed toys!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a crate pad for my young dog (older puppy). It has a little more stuffing that basic crate pads, which initially I thought of as a plus. But the puppy chewed up one end of the bed to get at the stuffing (which was all easily pulled out) and then I didn't like this feature so much anymore! :) Maybe it would have been better to spend more money on a more durable crate pad as this was in the end a waste of money for me. However, if your dog is not into stuffed toys (which is really what this bed appears to be, minus the squeakers), this may work very well for you!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Floppy. Not firm.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but that's about all. We specifically choose this for the 2-1/2 inch thickness. BIG disappointment - both thickness and functionality. It's filled with a polyfill type filling (like winter coat filling) not a foam pad. If you want something cutsey to look nice in your living room this might last a week or two..... until his teeth or toenails tear a hole in it. Two hours in a crate and ours had a hole.
customer_reviews.author: farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Soft, easy, fits in kennel and large capacity washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 5 star for chew proof but to be honest, I don’t really know. Our dog doesn’t chew it. It loves the softness. Rubs his face and body. Knows it’s his bed and just sleeps comfortably. It fits perfectly in those standard kennels. We have a large kennel and when our dog was a puppy we squeezed some of the cushion under the space separator to make the kennel smaller. The whole thing fits in my large capacity washer dryer. Returned to original state, doesn’t distort fade or lose softness in wash (perhaps gets even softer). I love it. It was a good purchase. Would buy it again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ironman

customer_reviews.title: Not plush. Smells gross.
customer_reviews.text: This pet may came out of the box wreaking like chemical or fish...I don’t know what it was. Anyway, the mat is fairly thin. It looks plush and thick from afar but when you pick it up, it’s super thin, light weight and not plush at all. Kind of like a stuffed animal prize from a bad carnival. Junk. It’s soft, but that’s about it. Didn’t return because my dog had already laid on it and I didn’t want to send back something covered in sheepdog hair. :/
customer_reviews.author: GiulianasMama

customer_reviews.title: Coming apart at the seams!
customer_reviews.text: What I wanted was a kennel pad I could easily wash as needed. This dog is 50lb and not a chewer and not overly active as a 10 year old. I noticed on day 2, the seams separating. The material used for the bottom has an unfinished edge all the way around the pad (inside). It is unraveling continually. The pad now has almost 50% separated seams! I will need to do repairs/permanent fix to the entire pad or else toss it. So disappointed in this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loved it as much as my wallet did.
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was very hesitant about buying this dog bed or any dog bed for my dogs. It's not easy keeping things together with a Doberman and a Cane Corso. Good thing this bed was comfortable and they liked it! The best part, besides the great price is the size and weight. It's not some big hotel mattress, the dogs actually pull it around when they want to lay somewhere different. I was really shocked when I washed it, it didnt fall a part, nothing melted in a quick dry cycle, and all the stuffing stayed right where it belonged.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Dobry

customer_reviews.title: Super soft bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed fits perfectly inside the training crate. It is super soft and feels really nice to the touch. I have not noticed the puppy chewing on it so I'm not sure about being chew proof. I have not had to clean it yet either. I did give softness 5 stars. So far it has worked well for us and should that change, I will update this review. At this time I would say this is a great value and perfect fit for any puppy and this crate particularly.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great economy bed for the price. And let me tell you, no bed is chew proof. We foster dogs and have found that chewers will chew through anything. I have a foster who chews through a stuffed toy in a few seconds, and to him, this is basically a BIG FLAT stuffed toy (that may or may not have a squeaker in it). I can buy a few of these for the same cost of the ones with thicker covers, and no tears were shed when He chewed a hole in it.
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: Cute, good price, doesn't show hair
customer_reviews.text: Many of the reviews said this was poor quality, but while it is thin, it is well constructed, has not pulled apart or pilled. It looks brand new after a year of use. There are little grippy dots on the bottom. It slips on my laminate floors, but a little bit of rubber mat underneath did the trick. It is priced very well and has held up as a crate pad. If using for a bed, I would put a cheap bed pillow underneath, as it is thin in the center.
customer_reviews.author: hates to shop

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary beds, do not last long-term
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2, one for each of our dog kennels and used them for 2 wks before the first wash. They are now useless. The claim is "washable" but what they don't tell you is that as soon as you do, the beds become a tattered, lumpy, clumpy mess of bunched up filling and you are never getting it back to its original shape. We threw them away and bought better quality off of Etsy.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Not as thick as it shows/states...
customer_reviews.text: Very soft but definitely thinner than 2 1/2 inches high. That was disappointing. My older dog needs something a bit thicker so I believe I'll need to add a blanket or two underneath. If you have a younger pup with no physical problems, it would be great. If you have an older furry baby, I'd try for something a bit thicker and more stable for their joints. Since I just received it, I'll update later as to how it does in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Box was almost open and the bed kinda smells bad so definitely washing it but it's the perfect size for my kittens crate. Could have a little more fluff in it but to be fair it's pretty cheap so it's obviously not going to be the best of the best. Might try adding a little extra fluff but other than that it feels nice, the bad smell came out with a short wash, and my cat likes it so definitely worth the $7. Soesn't stay super fuzzy after the second wash though
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Mullinax

customer_reviews.title: He LOVES It!!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I took this out of the box he started whining. I initially thought he might think it was a giant stuffed toy that he could chew, but as soon as this bed hit the ground, he jumped on it and laid down. I use this on the sofa that's been designated as his bed. It's a bit wide for that, but he doesn't seem to care, and he lays down and immediately falls asleep. I do wish that the cover came off. I'm not sure how I'm supposed to wash this thing in a machine with an agitator.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dogs NOT for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these dog beds. One for our Yorkie puppy and one for our chocolate lab. It’s great for our yorkie but our lab flattened his out VERY quickly. Other reviews said to wash and then it would fluff back up after flattening, but this one didn’t. Instead the inside stuffing lumped up in spots and removed from others. I threw it away, not meant for large, heavy dogs. I haven’t washed our small one yet to see how it turns out but it still looks great- our 5 pound dog loves it! Super soft!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Nice but does not wash well
customer_reviews.text: Come out of the washing machine in one big lump. I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbra Mcclung

product_meta.title: MidWest Homes for Pets Deluxe Super Plush Pet Beds, Machine Wash & Dryer Friendly, 1-Year Warranty
product_meta.description: Size:24-Inch| Color:GrayIf you want to spoil your best friend (whether they be a dog or a cat), the plush, tufted and over-stuffed QuiteTime Deluxe Ombré Swirl Pet Bed by MidWest Homes for Pets is the perfect pet bed for you! This pet bed is ideal for small dog breeds and cats weighing between 11-25 pounds. In neutral gray, these dog / cat beds will complement any home décor and provide your pet a cozy place to rest. All Ombré Swirl pet beds feature a “no-slip” surface on the bottom that’s perfect for hardwood or tile floors. They are machine washable and dryer safe, and they are sized to fit inside most standard dog crates creating a comfortable and desired location for your dog or cat to relax. For best results, machine wash, reshape, and lie flat to dry. Please note that the Quiet Time Ombre Swirl pet bed is not ideal for excessive “chewers” or dogs with high separation anxiety. If your dog is an excessive chewer, we suggest keeping a chew toy with your pet when in the crate in hopes your dog will chew the toy and not the pet bed. MidWest Homes for Pets stands behind the quality of our products with a 1-Year Manufacturer’s Warranty. If you have any questions regarding our dog beds or cat beds our customer service department would be glad to help you, available 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Monday – Friday EST.
feature_bullets: Ultra Plush pet Bed: Gray Ombré Swirl deluxe dog bed & cat bed works great as a stand alone pet bed or can be used inside a 24 inch long dog crate to create a comfortable pet home
Perfect pet Bed for Small Breeds: Ideal for dog & Cats weighing 11 25 pounds, this pet Bed measures approximately 23 Length x 18 Width x 2.5 Height Inches
Create a cozy den for your pet: Ultra Soft synthetic pet Bed provides additional comfort to Your dog's crate further enticing them to love using their crate
Stylish dog bed complements your home DÉCOR: Ombré Swirl pattern & neutral gray color looks great in the Home
Easy maintenance pet bed: Machine washable & dryer friendly pet bed Includes a 1 year MidWest quality guarantee manufacturer's warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
